question: 他人
sourceMnemonic: When you have an <kanji>other</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji>, you really have <vocabulary>another person</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>Another person</vocabulary> just stole your <reading>ta</reading>co and your <reading>Nin</reading>tendo (<ja>たにん</ja>). This complete <vocabulary>stranger</vocabulary> just walked up and took your taco and your Nintendo console straight out of your hands. Yoink.
